children.subject: Probably next week, latest the week after that

It's not a hard requirement that you be an AI for Data 100 before becoming a tutor or uGSI provided you have other teaching experience, but it's definitely a plus. I'll also mention that uGSI and tutor hiring is pretty much wrapped up for Spring 21, but I encourage you to apply for the summer and the fall if you're at all interested

Yeah no I knew that hiring was over for this semester. I don't think I could have even applied since if I remember correctly, I didn't even know my grade when hiring first started haha. But yes, I was planning on applying for summer and next fall, that's why I thought I would ask. 

So, would you recommend applying for AI for this Spring and then applying for a higher position for Summer/Fall as the best course of action? That way I would have AI'ed for Data 100 so that should be a plus for my application later down the line, right?
Yes, being an AI is definitely valuable experience that would help your application for course staff, but it's not a necessary requirement.
When do applications for these positions open up for summer and fall?
Generally the week before the term starts or the week that it starts. Either way, the forms will definitely be posted here so as long as you're checking Piazza regularly I doubt you'll miss them
Sorry I meant positions for READERS and GSIs for the courses
I'm not as sure of that, but I believe late March/early April for the summer and late April/early May for the fall?

If we've been an AI for other classes (as well as teaching through CSM) is it possible for us to directly apply for a role of reader/tutor for Data 100 if we did pretty well in the class (A grade)? Or do we need to be an AI first before we are allowed to be considered for the other roles?
Which 1-unit P/NP class with academic interns take? Is it an upper division course?

history.content:
Hello everyone!!

We’re looking for students at UC Berkeley who have taken Data 100, received a B or better (or a P for Spring 2020 or Fall 2020), are passionate about the course, and have the potential to become tutors and UGSIs in future semesters, to be Academic Interns for Spring 2021. Serving as an Academic Intern is a great way to help current students achieve mastery and have a good experience in Data 100. It is also a great way to prepare for becoming a tutor or UGSI in the future!

RESPONSIBILITIES

All Academic Interns enroll in a mandatory 1-unit P/NP class offered by the course faculty. This corresponds to three hours of time commitment per week.The typical breakdown of the three hours is:
- 1 hour of preparation (e.g. studying the week’s assignments, consulting with senior staff, etc.)
- 1 hour of assisting students
- 1 hour for pedagogy practice, (U)GSI check-ins, AI team meetings, etc

APPLICATION DEADLINE: Wednesday, 1/20 at 11:59pm PST

If you have any questions, feel free to send them to rkunani@berkeley.edu.

Here is the application link.
history.subject: Data 100 Spring 2021 Academic Intern Applications
